==Early life and military career==
==Early life and military career==
===Family background and early education===
===Family background and early education===
â
Mclovin was born in [[Panama]] at the [[Coco Solo|Coco Solo Air Base]] in the then American-controlled [[Panama Canal Zone]] to [[Admiral]] [[John S. McCain, Jr.]] and [[Roberta McCain|Roberta (Wright) McCain]]. Although McCain was not born within a [[U.S. state|state]] of the United States, his US citizenship (and future eligibility to be elected to the presidency) was assured at birth both by ''[[jus sanguinis]]'', since both of his parents were U.S. citizens, and ''[[jus soli]]'', as the Canal Zone was at that time a United States possession. Both his father and grandfather were [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] admirals. His father commanded American forces in Vietnam while McCain was a prisoner of war. His grandfather [[John S. McCain, Sr.]] commanded naval aviation at the [[Battle of Okinawa]] in 1945.
+
McCain was born in [[Panama]] at the [[Coco Solo|Coco Solo Air Base]] in the then American-controlled [[Panama Canal Zone]] to [[Admiral]] [[John S. McCain, Jr.]] and [[Roberta McCain|Roberta (Wright) McCain]]. Although McCain was not born within a [[U.S. state|state]] of the United States, his US citizenship (and future eligibility to be elected to the presidency) was assured at birth both by ''[[jus sanguinis]]'', since both of his parents were U.S. citizens, and ''[[jus soli]]'', as the Canal Zone was at that time a United States possession. Both his father and grandfather were [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] admirals. His father commanded American forces in Vietnam while McCain was a prisoner of war. His grandfather [[John S. McCain, Sr.]] commanded naval aviation at the [[Battle of Okinawa]] in 1945.
For the first ten years of his life, McCain was frequently uprooted as his family followed his father to [[New London, Connecticut]], [[Pearl Harbor, Hawaii]] and various other stations in the [[Pacific Ocean]]; McCain attended whatever naval base school was available, often to the detriment to his education.<ref name="alexander-19">{{cite book | title = Man of the People: The Life of John McCain | first = Paul | last = Alexander | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=9jN5cwr_YIwC&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Man+of+the+People%22&sig=BXDf3N8PIDpDkNEH95RhDJsdAMU | id = ISBN 0-471-22829-X | year = 2002 | publisher = [[John Wiley & Sons]]|pages=p. 19}}</ref> As a child, he was known for a quick temper and an aggressive drive to compete and prevail.<ref name="alexander-19"/> After [[World War II]] was over, the family settled in [[Northern Virginia]]; McCain attended the educationally stronger [[St. Stephen's and St. Agnes School|St. Stephen's School]] in [[Alexandria, Virginia]] from 1946 to 1949.<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 20.</ref> Another two years was then spent following his father around to naval stations;<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 21.</ref> altogether he would go to about twenty different schools during his youth.<ref name="ap-wmd"/> He then attended [[Episcopal High School (Alexandria)|Episcopal High School]] in Alexandria beginning in 1951; it is a top private school with a rigorous honor code.<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 22.</ref> McCain earned two [[varsity letter]]s in [[scholastic wrestling|wrestling]],<ref name="alexander-28"/> where he excelled in the lighter [[Wrestling weight classes|weight classes]].<ref name="az-naval"/> He had a continued reputation as a fiery and contentious personality<ref name="alexander-28">Alexander (2002), p. 28.</ref> and graduated from high school in 1954.
For the first ten years of his life, McCain was frequently uprooted as his family followed his father to [[New London, Connecticut]], [[Pearl Harbor, Hawaii]] and various other stations in the [[Pacific Ocean]]; McCain attended whatever naval base school was available, often to the detriment to his education.<ref name="alexander-19">{{cite book | title = Man of the People: The Life of John McCain | first = Paul | last = Alexander | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=9jN5cwr_YIwC&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Man+of+the+People%22&sig=BXDf3N8PIDpDkNEH95RhDJsdAMU | id = ISBN 0-471-22829-X | year = 2002 | publisher = [[John Wiley & Sons]]|pages=p. 19}}</ref> As a child, he was known for a quick temper and an aggressive drive to compete and prevail.<ref name="alexander-19"/> After [[World War II]] was over, the family settled in [[Northern Virginia]]; McCain attended the educationally stronger [[St. Stephen's and St. Agnes School|St. Stephen's School]] in [[Alexandria, Virginia]] from 1946 to 1949.<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 20.</ref> Another two years was then spent following his father around to naval stations;<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 21.</ref> altogether he would go to about twenty different schools during his youth.<ref name="ap-wmd"/> He then attended [[Episcopal High School (Alexandria)|Episcopal High School]] in Alexandria beginning in 1951; it is a top private school with a rigorous honor code.<ref>Alexander (2002), p. 22.</ref> McCain earned two [[varsity letter]]s in [[scholastic wrestling|wrestling]],<ref name="alexander-28"/> where he excelled in the lighter [[Wrestling weight classes|weight classes]].<ref name="az-naval"/> He had a continued reputation as a fiery and contentious personality<ref name="alexander-28">Alexander (2002), p. 28.</ref> and graduated from high school in 1954.
